abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Municipal Sector
            Development Project is rated as satisfactory. The lessons
            learned include: 1) The engagement of sectoral experts to
            prepare institutional development programs, and priority
            investment projects for financing under the municipal
            infrastructure investment component resulted in a robust
            pipeline of well-prepared sub-projects prior to approval of
            the project by International Development Association's
            Executive Directors. 2) The administrative and financial
            systems, technical assistance, and training provided under
            the municipal strengthening component of the project were
            successfully implemented, which can be attributed to the
            built-in pilot programs. 3) Project implementation benefited
            from a strong government commitment to the project's
            overall objectives of promoting efficient municipal
            management. 4) It is important that project components to be
            included only after Borrower has confirmed its willingness
            to include the component in the project. 5) A good set of
            performance indicators plays an important role in assisting
            borrowers in monitoring a project's progress during
            implementation and assessing the project's potential
            benefits during operation. The original performance
            indicators were inadequate to cover all the specific
            components of the project. 6) High staff turnover could be
            partly attributed to the systemic problem of the project. 7)
            Severance payments play an important role in the
            implementation of institutional reforms.
